meanings.definition: A selection or extract from a text, especially a religious text.
meanings.sent1: The priest read a pericope from the Bible during the church service.
meanings.sent2: In literature class, we analyzed a pericope from a famous novel.
meanings.sent3: The pericope about the talking animals in the story always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite pericope from the play was the emotional monologue by the main character.
meanings.sent5: The pericope describing the magical forest was so vivid that it felt like I was there.

meanings.definition: A passage from a book or document.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to summarize the pericope they had just read.
meanings.sent2: I found an interesting pericope in the history textbook.
meanings.sent3: The pericope detailing the ancient civilization's customs was quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The pericope on page 50 provided crucial information for the research paper.
meanings.sent5: As I read the pericope aloud, the words seemed to come to life in the room.
